Kemenhub: Empat Trayek Tol Laut Dimonopoli Swasta
01 Nov 2019, 08:57 by Francisca Christy Rosana, Ali Akhmad Noor Hidayat
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Kementerian Perhubungan mencatat ada empat trayek pengiriman barang via tol laut yang berpotensi dimonopoli oleh perusahaan swasta. Direktur Lalu Lintas dan Angkutan Laut Wisnu Handoko merinci keempatnya ialah trayek Tanjung Priok - Namlea, Tanjung Prio - Dobo, Tanjung Priok - Saumlaki, dan Tanjung Priok - Wasior.
"Kebanyakan trayek yang dimonopoli memang di Indonesia bagian timur. Ini terjadi karena pengirimannya paling besar ke sana," ujar Wisnu di kantornya, Jalan Medan Merdeka Barat, Jakarta Pusat, Jumat, 1 November 2019.
Wisnu menjelaskan, sejatinya problem monopoli telah diendus oleh kementeriannya sejak lama. Dugaan monopoli itu kentara dari laporan pengawasan operasional pengiriman barang yang telah dilakukan oleh masing-masing kantor kesyahbandaran dan otoritas pelabuhan.
Wisnu memastikan telah meminta pihak KSOP untuk mengetatkan pengawasan terhadap pengiriman barang. Namun, ia berdalih kementeriannya tidak berwenang menyentuh bisnis perdagangan.
"Jadi kalau harga kan punya mekanisme pemantuan harga pasar. Dari kami, kalau misalnya pemain yang ada di situ gimana, kami mengawasi," ujarnya.
Untuk memperketat pengawasan, pada 2018, Kementerian Perhubungan lantas membangun sistem digital untuk melacak arus barang masuk dan keluar melalui platform informasi muatan ruang kerja alias IMRK. Melalui sistem itu, Kementerian Perhubungan dapat mencatat perusahaan-perusahaan swasta mana saja yang terlibat sebagai pelaku pengirim muatan.
Namun, ia mengakui sistem digital pengawasan itu perlu diperbarui dalam waktu dekat. Sementara itu, untuk menindaklanjuti adanya dugaan monopoli, Kementerian Perhubungan akan menggelar rapat dengan Komisi Pengawas Persaingan Usaha atau KPPU.
"Kami akan rapat dengan KPPU besok Sabtu (2 November 2019) di Surabaya," tuturnya.
Menteri Perhubungan Budi Karya Sumadi sebelumnya menyatakan telah menerima sejumlah laporan terkait dugaan monopoli tol laut dari pemerintah daerah, khususnya di Maluku.
"Terutama di Maluku, jadi memang kami sudah mensinyalir bahwa terjadi satu penguasaan barang yang secara berlebihan," ujar Budi Karya di Hotel Borobudur, Jakarta Pusat, Kamis, 31 Oktober 2019.
Akibat monopoli tol laut, Budi Karya mengatakan beberapa bupati mengeluhkan tarif pengiriman barang yang melonjak. Karenanya, kata dia, daerah tidak lagi merasakan harga normal pengapalan barang seperti saat pertama kali program ini diluncurkan.
Program yang digadang-gadang dapat mengurangi disparitas harga itu pun berangsur tidak efektif. Menindaklajuti aduan ini, Budi Karya memastikan kementeriannya akan segera menindak pihak-pihak yang disinyalir melakukan penyelewengan.
Masalah monopoli tol laut juga sempat disinggung oleh Presiden Joko Widodo atau Jokowi. Jokowo mengaku mendapat laporan ada monopoli perusahaan swasta soal tol laut. Ia menyayangkan hal ini lantaran program tol laut mendapat apresiasi dari masyarakat dan pemerintah daerah karena berhasil menurunkan inflasi dan harga barang.

Ministry of Transportation: Four Private Monopolized Sea Toll Routes
01 Nov 2019, 08:57 by Francisca Christy Rosana, Ali Akhmad Noor Hidayat
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The Ministry of Transportation noted that there are four goods shipping routes via sea tolls that have the potential to be monopolized by private companies. The Director of Sea Traffic and Transportation, Wisnu Handoko, detailed the four routes of the Tanjung Priok - Namlea, Tanjung Prio - Dobo, Tanjung Priok - Saumlaki, and Tanjung Priok - Wasior routes.
"Most monopolized routes are indeed in eastern Indonesia. This is because the largest shipments go there," Wisnu said in his office, Jalan Medan Merdeka Barat, Central Jakarta, Friday, November 1, 2019.
Wisnu explained, the true problem of monopoly had been sniffed out by his ministry for a long time. The monopoly allegation is apparent from the operational supervision reports on goods shipments that have been carried out by each port office and port authority.
Wisnu confirmed that he had asked the KSOP to tighten supervision of the shipping of goods. However, he argued his ministry was not authorized to touch the trade business.
"So if prices have a mechanism to monitor market prices. From us, if for example the players who are there, what about us, we supervise," he said.
To tighten supervision, in 2018, the Ministry of Transportation then built a digital system to track the flow of goods in and out through the workspace information platform alias IMRK. Through the system, the Ministry of Transportation can record which private companies are involved as the sender.
However, he acknowledged that the digital surveillance system needs to be updated in the near future. Meanwhile, to follow up on the alleged monopoly, the Ministry of Transportation will hold a meeting with the Business Competition Supervisory Commission or KPPU.
"We will have a meeting with KPPU tomorrow Saturday (2 November 2019) in Surabaya," he said.
The Minister of Transportation, Budi Karya Sumadi, previously stated that he had received a number of reports related to the alleged sea toll monopoly from the regional government, especially in Maluku.
"Especially in Maluku, so indeed we have already indicated that there is an excessive possession of goods," said Budi Karya at the Borobudur Hotel, Central Jakarta, Thursday, 31 October 2019.
As a result of the sea toll monopoly, Budi Karya said several regents complained about the soaring freight rates. Therefore, he said, the regions no longer felt the normal price of shipping goods like when the program was first launched.
The program that is predicted can reduce the price disparity, it is gradually ineffective. Following this complaint, Budi Karya ensured that his ministry would immediately take action against parties suspected of carrying out fraud.
The problem of the sea toll monopoly was also mentioned by President Joko Widodo or Jokowi. Jokowo admitted that he received a report that there was a monopoly by a private company about the sea toll. He regretted this because the sea highway program received appreciation from the community and local government for successfully reducing inflation and the price of goods.
